comments.body: could you please tests with `given` and `new` anonymous? and whatever else can potentially use a template.
Added tests in a separate suite for Scala 3 (I had some issues with the implicit dialect, so decided that it's safer)
Test changes beside the dotty suites mostly deal with the structure being changed (templates additional Nil etc.)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +592,596 @@  test("package foo; class C; package baz { class D }") {
    val tree = source("package foo; class C; package baz { class D }")
    assertNoDiff(
      tree.structure,
      """Source(List(Pkg(Term.Name("foo"), List(Defn.Class(Nil, Type.Name("C"), Nil, Ctor.Primary(Nil, Name(""), Nil), Template(Nil, Nil, Self(Name(""), None), Nil, Nil)), Pkg(Term.Name("baz"), List(Defn.Class(Nil, Type.Name("D"), Nil, Ctor.Primary(Nil, Name(""), Nil), Template(Nil, Nil, Self(Name(""), None), Nil, Nil))))))))"""

comments.body:
What happens in the following cases?
```scala
    assert(q"val `//` = 2".syntax == "val `//` = 2")
    assert(q"val `/*` = 2".syntax == "val `/*` = 2")
```

iirc, in akka-http they have backticked identifiers with `/*`

In scala-syntax we use https://github.com/scalacenter/scala-syntax/blob/7352163153066bf9594d63c8e78d62aaa9123656/format/src/main/scala/org/scalafmt/internal/Identifier.scala that we adapted from the Ammonite codebase.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +647,651 @@    assert(q"val `a+` = 2".syntax == "val `a+` = 2")
    assert(q"val `a-b` = 2".syntax == "val `a-b` = 2")
    assert(q"val `a:b` = 2".syntax == "val `a:b` = 2")

    // Comments must be handled carefully
